Bulbophyllum pectinatum Finet, Bull. Soc. Bot.
France
44: 268, 1897

subSubSection.paragraph:

Bulbophyllum spectabile Rolfe, Bull. Misc. Inform. Kew 1898: 193
, 1898.

Distribution:— Northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina, southwestern China and Taiwan .

Bulbophyllum penicillium C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.
f., Trans. Linn. Soc. London 30: 151, 1874. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , 1870,
Parish 303
( lectotype K, designated by Clayton 2017: 65 ; isolectotype: W-R; icon. W-R 2279 )

Homotypic synonym:
Phyllorkis penicillium
(C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl.
2: 677, 1891.

Specimens examined:—
KACHIN . Putao District :
1100 m
,
22−24 Mar 2009
,
Kurzweil & Saw Lwin KL 2737
( SING , SING [s]); same loc.,
Mar 2009
,
Kurzweil & Saw Lwin KL
s.n. [no. 10] ( SING ); same loc.,
Dec 2015
,
Saw Lwin KSL 1088 & 1094
( RAF )
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : type . WITHOUT
LOCALITY.
Cult. Glasnevin Bot. Gard.
s.n. ( K ). Reported from
Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 67)
, but we have not seen any material from this area.
Distribution:— The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar and southwestern China .

Note:— A record from Thailand is referable to
Bulbophyllum lanuginosum J.J.Verm.

Bulbophyllum pictum C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.
f., Trans. Linn. Soc. London 30: 150, 1874. Type :— MYANMAR . Tanintharyi Region : Myeik District ,
Parish 264
( holotype : K)

Homotypic synonym:
Trias picta
(C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.f.) C.S.P.Parish ex Hemsl., Gard. Chron ., n.s., 18: 427, 1882.

Specimens examined:—
TANINTHARYI . Dawei District :
Kurzweil s.n.
, photo; Myeik District : type . Also reported from
Mon State by
Kress et al. (2003: 89
; as
Trias picta
), but we have not seen any material from this area.
